items.title: NCDEX gets in-principle Sebi nod to launch equities, derivatives; plans Rs 750 crore fundraise: Source
items.description: NCDEX has received in-principle approval from Sebi to launch its equity and equity derivatives segment, subject to certain conditions including maintaining robust commodity volumes and IT timelines. The exchange plans to invest ₹750 crore to develop the segment, starting with cash offerings. This move diversifies NCDEX's offerings and positions it against competitors like MSE, leveraging its rural penetration.

Analysts advise caution, suggesting investors avoid new entries and consider exiting existing positions until stability is confirmed, given the ongoing investigations and reputational risks.

items.description: NSDL shares debuted on the stock exchanges on August 6, achieving a premium over the IPO price of Rs 800. The Rs 4,012 crore IPO witnessed substantial oversubscription, particularly from QIBs. NSDL, a key player in India's dematerialized securities market, reported revenue and profit growth in FY25, attracting long-term investors due to its institutional importance and dividend history.

items.title: Pharma stocks in focus as Trump warns tariffs could hit 250%
items.description: Pharma stocks such as Sun Pharma, Cipla, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, Lupin, and others will be in focus on Wednesday after US President Donald Trump said tariffs on imported pharmaceuticals could rise to as high as 250%. The proposed tariffs would start at a lower rate but escalate over time, he said in a CNBC interview.

items.description: On August 5, five stocks from the NSE midcap pack appeared in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from stockedge.com. This can be interpreted as a potential bullish indicator and is often used by traders to identify possible buying opportunities.

items.title: Sensex falls over 200 pts, Nifty below 24,600 after RBI keeps rates steady amid tariff uncertainty
items.description: Indian benchmark indices experienced a flat trade on Wednesday as the RBI maintained the repo rate at 5.5%. Market sentiment was further dampened by concerns over potential US tariffs on Indian goods, particularly pharmaceuticals, following President Trump's statements. Global markets also showed weakness due to concerns about the impact of tariffs on economic activity.

items.title: At multi-year highs! JK Cement and 6 other stocks witness 5-year swing high breakouts
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks with a market cap over Rs 1,000 crore, seven stocks hit a 5-year swing high at the close on August 5, indicating bullish sentiment in these counters, according to technical scan data from stockedge.com.A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year period. This level often acts as a significant resistance point, where the price has historically struggled to move beyond. Hitting this level may be seen as a bullish signal, suggesting the potential for further upward movement. However, it's important to note that this differs from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when a stock’s price decisively surpasses a resistance level that has held firm for five years or more.

items.title: Auto stocks: Yes, headwinds in the short term, but will structural change become tailwinds and prove analysts wrong?
items.description: While the Q1 earnings season has been a mixed bag, the auto sector would fall in the category of those that have not delivered any negative surprises. Now, does that mean you should start looking at them as investors? The answer is in a grey area. There is a transformation which is still underway, and like all other sectoral transformations, there will be some winners and some losers. One reason, however, to keep these stocks on a watchlist is that Indian auto majors hardly export any vehicles to the US, so the negative sentiment impacting other sectors will not hit them. At the same time, there is a headwind which may or may not become big. But the fact is that India's growth story is incomplete without the auto sector. So, eventually, the headwinds will not matter.

items.title: Pidilite Industries board to meet today to consider first bonus issue in 15 years
items.description: Pidilite Industries’ board is meeting today to consider its first bonus share issue in 15 years and a special interim dividend for FY26. The outcome, including dividend quantum and bonus ratio, will follow post-meeting. The move highlights management’s confidence and aims to boost liquidity. Shares traded flat ahead of announcement.

items.title: Deven Choksey backs PB Balaji as ideal leader for JLR, urges caution on defence stocks
items.description: Deven Choksey, in an interview with ET Now, affirmed that PB Balaji is a fitting choice to lead JLR. At Tata Motors, Balaji inherited a challenging situation but successfully restructured operations. Under his financial leadership, the passenger vehicle (PV) segment witnessed strong growth, and the commercial vehicle (CV) business regained momentum. Importantly, JLR—once seen as the toughest piece—now stands to benefit from Balaji’s turnaround expertise.

items.title: European shares rise as investors buy dips, shrug off US tariff threats
items.description: European shares extended gains on Wednesday as investors bought into recent market weakness, brushing aside fresh U.S. tariff threats and digesting a mixed batch of corporate earnings.

items.title: M&B Engineering shares jump 9% after flat listing
items.description: M&B Engineering shares rose nearly 9% on NSE post a flat listing. Its Rs 650 crore IPO saw strong demand across investor segments. The company, operating in pre-engineered buildings and roofing solutions, plans to use proceeds for expansion, debt repayment, and IT upgrades. FY25 net profit surged 69% YoY.

items.description: "Investors bought stocks because the gains of the Nikkei in the previous session were not enough to recoup declines on Monday," said Naoki Fujiwara, a senior fund manager at Shinkin Asset Management.

Strong topline growth is likely, driven by Zudio expansion, but profitability could be hit due to higher costs and lower margins.

items.description: Cathay Pacific Airways on Wednesday warned of declining airfares, challenges at its budget carrier and uncertain cargo market conditions, sending its shares down more than 10% after it posted a slight rise in first-half profit.

items.title: Trump’s Tariff Strategy: Reshaping the pharma and tech supply chain
items.description: President Donald Trump announced that the U.S. would impose a “small tariff” on pharmaceutical imports initially, which would rise to 150% within 18 months and eventually reach 250%. This move is part of his broader plan to encourage domestic manufacturing in the pharmaceutical sector. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Reliance Infra, Reliance Power sink up to 19% in 6 sessions amid Rs 17,000 cr loan fraud probe

items.title: Gland Pharma shares rally 6% as brokerages lift ratings, target prices; here's why

The Bank Nifty slipped 0.2%, while the Nifty Realty index dropped 2.3%. Investors await clarity on trade negotiations and upcoming economic data, including trade figures and inflation, for further market direction. Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index saw minimal gains.

Revenue rose 81%, driven by robust execution in its core T&D segment. With a growing order book and bullish management commentary, the stock is now trading 76% above its IPO price after months of underperformance.

items.title: Uber unveils $20 billion stock buyback plan as loyalty program boosts growth

items.title: Curb misleading claims, modernise onboarding and reporting: Sebi chief to portfolio managers

He cautioned against misleading performance claims, emphasizing the need for transparency and client education regarding risk-return trade-offs. The industry's growth necessitates upholding governance standards to preserve investor trust.
